solution.text:
We know, Dividend = Divisor \(\times \) Quotient + Remainder
\(\Rightarrow \frac {Dividend - Remainder}{Quotient}= Divisor\)
So we divide \(_{{j*l}}_x^3+_{{j+k*l}}_x^2+_{{j*m+k+1}}_x+_{{k*m+n}}_-_{n}_-x\) by \(_{j}_x+_{k}_\)
First to obtain \(_{{j*l}}_x^3\) we multiply \((_{j}_x+_{k}_)\) by \(_{l}_x^2\)
secondly to obtain \(_{j}_x^2\) we multiply \((_{j}_x+_{k}_)\) by \(x\)
finally to obtain \(_{{j*m}}_x\) we multiply \((_{j}_x+_{k}_)\) by _{m}_
\(\require{enclose}\begin{array}{r} _{l}_x^2+x+_{m}_ \\[-3pt] _{j}_x+_{k}_\enclose{longdiv}{_{{j*l}}_x^3+_{{j+k*l}}_x^2+_{{j*m+k}}_x+_{{k*m}}_} \\[-3pt] \underline{_{{j*l}}_x^3+_{{k*l}}_x^2}\phantom{2} \\[-3pt] _{j}_x^2+_{{j*m+k}}_x \\[-3pt] \underline{_{j}_x^2+_{k}_x}\phantom{2} \\[-3pt] _{{j*m}}_x+_{{k*m}}_ \\[-3pt] \underline{_{{j*m}}_x+_{{k*m}}_}\phantom{2} \\[-3pt] 0\end{array}\)
hence \(g(x)=_{l}_x^2+x+_{m}_\)

content.text:
On dividing \(_{{j*l}}_x^3+_{{j+k*l}}_x^2+_{{j*m+k+1}}_x+_{{k*m+n}}_\) by a polynomial \(g(x)\),
,the quotient and remainder were \(_{j}_x+_{k}_\) and \(_{n}_+x\), respectively.
Find the polynomial g(x).
